# Checklist
- [x] class constructor and destructor
- [x] class methods with primitive arguments and return values
- [x] methods/functions with class arguments
- [x] template instantiation (SWIG should already handle this)
- inheritance (only base class holds pointer)
- [x] Ownership on fortran classes: return-by-value, return-by-new, const
  reference
- Move class return values to parameter values? (allow overloading for plist)
- [x] multiple constructors
- [x] `RCP/shared_ptr` wrapping (SWIG should already handle this)
- [x] "generic" function overloading
- [x] templated class method instantiation (needed for plist)
- [x] namespaces
- [x] string wrapping
- [x] passing entire arrays of data in a single call
- [x] Add 'intent' qualifiers to arguments?
- [x] passing classes by value? (atypical fortran usage; RCP though)
- [x] static methods/data
- [x] Fortran callback functions
- [x] enumerations?
- [ ] global const data?
- [ ] "director" capability to subclass a c++ class using a Fortran class
- [ ] Multiple interacting modules
- [ ] Iterators?
- [x] Optional generation of `final` statement for auto-destruction
- [ ] Optional typemap for checking validity of pointers (class must be
  constructed)
- [x] Find out about quirks of C++ static object initialization when executed
  by a Fortran `main` function (no problems with gcc; see the SimpleClass
  example)
- [x] Exception handling?
- [ ] Error checking (pointers being assigned)?
- [ ] dynamic-cast type checking for inheritance upcasts?
